Posts.Content: lisa71971 wrote: On the report it says FINDINGS:"There is a cluster of microcalcifications seen in the posterior third of the right breast prjoecting in the lateral quadratns not identified on the MLO vview. Otherwise there are no suspicious mass lesions or areas of achetechtural distortion. IMPRESSION: Cluster of microcalcifications seen in the right breast are only identified on CC projection and may represent superimposed calcifications from different parts of the breast. Would recommend further evaluation.  I also have heterogeneously dense breasts. The BI-RADS Category was 0 and then said incomplete assessment so maybe they need to do the other mammogram to rate it?? I looked online and they say the clusters are suspicious if they are clustered a certain way or shape. It doesn't say how they are clustered on this report or do they? I am so confused I am confused because it says not suspicious, but wouldn't the microcalcifications be suspicious? This breast hurts as well. :( I am 40, I have a 20 year old daughter and a 4 year old daughter. If I didn't have my girls I probably wouldn't be so worried. Anyone else have anything similar? Thank you!!   ~Lisa Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: lisa71971 wrote: Hi  I posted earlier that I had a cluster of microcalcifications..I actually got in today to have other views done and I talked to the radiologist and thinks they are BENIGN!! YAY!!! He said of course he can only be 97 percent sure but the pattern of the cluster is not suspicsious. He said to come back in 6 months. He said the only way to know for sure is to have a biopsy done. I (being the worry wart that I am) am going to have another radiologist look at them and I might even have a biopsy to make sure. Thanks for all your replies and I hope all your reports are good. PEACE AND LOVE to all of you :)  ~Lisa Log in to post a reply
